trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_SEQ_00<tab>Chai-Nuzz is looking not a little anxious.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Dulia-Chai.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_TODO_01<tab>Search for the Crystal Exarch.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the Crystal Exarch.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_000<tab>Oh, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, my dear. I regret to say that all this moving about has begun to take its toll. Yet my darling husband soldiers on like the redoubtable soul he is.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_005<tab>I am entirely unqualified to help him with the Talos, of course, but I do what I can to make him more comfortable. A cup of water here, a massage there...
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_CHAINUZZ_000_010<tab>Gah, there's no point worrying about such things now. I'll get back to my calculations. You, meanwhile, should go and rest as your friends suggested.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_CHAINUZZ_000_011<tab>My wife and the Exarch should be in the tavern. Why don't you join them?
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_CHAINUZZ_000_012<tab>Oh, and <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? Ahem... Thank you.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_CHAINUZZ_000_020<tab>Why are you still here? Go and get some rest while you can!
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_030<tab>...The Exarch? He went outside a moment ago, my dear. I would've thought you'd have seen him.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_031<tab>He kept me company for a short while, but then he came over rather pale. He's clearly been straining himself, the poor thing.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_032<tab>Anyway, he excused himself, saying that he needed a breath of fresh air. Weak as he looked, I did offer to go with him, but he assured me he would be fine. I do hope he's all right...
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_040<tab>Did you find the Exarch? I don't imagine he could have gone far...
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_SYSTEM_000_050<tab>The Exarch does not appear to be nearby.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_BALAENICEPSREX_000_051<tab>...
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_SYSTEM_000_052<tab>The Exarch does not appear to be anywhere in the vicinity. There is only the shoebill, gazing unflinchingly southward.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_CHAINUZZ_000_060<tab>There you are! Ahhh, what a relief... When Dulia told me that the Exarch had disappeared, and that you had been a long time finding him, I had feared the worst had happened right before the moment of truth!
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_DULIACHAI_000_065<tab>The Exarch is back, thank heavens, and it seems the sea breeze did him a world of good! I do hope you managed to get a spot of rest as well!
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_MYSTERYVOICE_000_070<tab>Worry not, my friend. I am much revived for the fresh air─and your fine company, of course. Now then, let us turn our thoughts back to the task at hand.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_SYSTEM_000_900<tab>Meanwhile, in the imperial palace in the Source...
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_901<tab>(-Zenos-)Your Radiance. I have taken the liberty of quashing the vile rumors that your heir is possessed by a devil.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_902<tab>(-Zenos-)With the nation in the grip of war, we may rely on patriotic zeal to prevent them from resurfacing.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_VARIS_000_903<tab>And what of Emet-Selch?
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_904<tab>(-Zenos-)He has taken himself to the First, to usher that world to its end.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_905<tab>(-Zenos-)Or so I believe. He did not disclose the details of his mission, having ever preferred to work alone.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_906<tab>(-Zenos-)Even to those who have known him since the beginning, his actions can prove...unpredictable.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_VARIS_000_907<tab>I am no stranger to his ways. He joys in playing me for a fool. Full many times have I been convinced I was acting of my own volition, only to discover all was as he willed it.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_VARIS_000_908<tab>My dear grandfather...
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_909<tab>(-Zenos-)On the subject of our esteemed colleague: his last report, though brief, did contain one item of interest.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_910<tab>(-Zenos-)You have doubtless wondered why the Scions of the Seventh Dawn have not taken the field of late.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_911<tab>(-Zenos-)It is because they are no longer in the Source.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_912<tab>(-Zenos-)The hero of the Scions has journeyed to the First─as have <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> comrades, albeit incompletely. Their bodies yet remain here in the Source.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_913<tab>(-Zenos-)This presents an opportunity. If we can defeat the Alliance prior to the Scions' return, we may eliminate their order at a stroke.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_914<tab>(-Zenos-)And with the Scions gone, none shall remain to thwart our plans. It will be but a matter of striking down the hero upon <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> homecoming.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_915<tab>(-Zenos-)Which, lest you forget, is essential to the realization of our objective. Of <var 1A 02 /var>both<var 1A 01 /var> of our objectives.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_916<tab>(-Zenos-)Through Hydaelyn's meddling, Her champions threaten to wrest the reins of fate from our grasp. The world is at risk of being dragged down the false path.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_917<tab>(-Zenos-)One which will never see man reclaim his true form.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_918<tab>(-Zenos-)'Tis unthinkable that he should supplant us, incomplete as he is. Such a devolution is abhorrent. And it must be stopped─before it is too late.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_919<tab>(-Zenos-)The hour is come, Your Radiance. Order your armies to march once more. Crush all who stand in your way.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_920<tab>(-Zenos-)This is your heart's desire, is it not? To seize a victory that is yours and yours alone─for the future of Garlemald!
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ZENOS_000_921<tab>(-???-)Oh <var 1A 02 /var>dear<var 1A 01 /var>... You do not wear the mummer's motley well. I was never one to take an interest in tedious conflicts.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ZENOS_000_922<tab>The whereabouts of my one true friend, however─<var 1A 02 /var>they<var 1A 01 /var> interest me greatly. I but hope the beasts of this “First” are providing <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var> proper sport.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ZENOS_000_923<tab>I would know every detail, Lord Zenos. Or would you rather I called you Elidibus?
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_924<tab>(-Elidibus-)...Hm. Unexpected. Most unexpected.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_925<tab>(-Elidibus-)That immortality should be within the reach of one with a <var 1A 02 /var>borrowed<var 1A 01 /var> Echo.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ROBEMAN_000_926<tab>(-Elidibus-)You have outdone yourself, Zenos yae Galvus.

TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ZENOS_000_927<tab>I have no particular attachment to that name─but I <var 1A 02 /var>am<var 1A 01 /var> rather fond of that body. Without it, I cannot enjoy my hunt to the fullest.
TEXT_LUCKME113_03642_ZENOS_000_928<tab>Your secrets or my flesh. I care not which you give me first. The choice is yours.
